title: Introduction to shinyrepro
text: single exported function, repro, take reactive object, returns character vector code required run outside Shiny re-create specified reactive.

title: Introduction to shinyrepro
text: Currently hard check contents anonymous functions inputs /reactive objects, functions used apply family functions purrr::map. workaround named arguments, therefore sent anonymous function updated shinyrepro.
code: # Bad purrr::map_dbl(1:10, \(x) x * input$mult)  # Good purrr::map_dbl(1:10, mult = input$mult, \(x, mult) x * mult)

title: Reproducible Code for Shiny Objects
text: aim {shinyrepro} able recreate output available Shiny application outside application .

title: Reproducible Code for Shiny Objects
text: get latest version {shinyrepro}, install GitHub:

title: Reproducible Code for Shiny Objects
text: {shinyrepro} one exported function, repro(), takes reactive object converts script can reused outside Shiny application reproduce result reactive. can sent simple verbatimTextOutput something UX friendly {highlighter} package display script UI.

title: Reproducible Code for Shiny Objects
code: library(shiny) library(shinyrepro)  library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   h1("Reproducible Code Example"),   inputPanel(     sliderInput(       "min_width",       "Minimum Petal Width",       min(iris$Petal.Width),       max(iris$Petal.Width),       min(iris$Petal.Width),       step = 0.1     ),     selectInput(       "summary_fn",       "Summary Function",       c("Mean" = "mean", "Median" = "median", "SD" = "sd"),       selected = "mean"     )   ),   fluidRow(     column(       width = 5,       h2("Table"),       tableOutput("table")     ),     column(       width = 7,       h2("Code"),       verbatimTextOutput("code")     )   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   iris_filt <- reactive({     iris[with(iris, Petal.Width > input$min_width), ]   })    summary_tbl <- reactive({     aggregate(       Sepal.Width ~ Species,       data = iris_filt(),       FUN = get(input$summary_fn)     )   })    output$table <- renderTable(summary_tbl())   output$code <- renderText(repro(summary_tbl)) }  shinyApp(ui, server)

title: Call Checks — is_reactive_call
text: set helper functions determine type call made within expression. is_reactive_call checks whether call evaluating reactive variable. is_reactive_val_call checks whether call evaluating reactiveVal variable. is_reactive_values_call checks whether call evaluating item within reactiveValues variable. is_any_reactive_call checks whether call points evaluating reactive, reactiveVal reactiveValues. is_input_call checks whether call points evaluation input value.

title: Call Checks — is_reactive_call
code: is_reactive_call(x, env = rlang::caller_env())  is_reactive_val_call(x, env = rlang::caller_env())  is_reactive_values_call(x, env = rlang::caller_env())  is_any_reactive_call(x, env = rlang::caller_env())  is_input_call(x)

title: Call Checks — is_reactive_call
text: x R call object env environment call made, default environment calling check, likely environment call made .e. reactive expression.

title: Call Checks — is_reactive_call
text: boolean value determining whether call check passed.

title: Reactive Variables Definition Check — is_new_reactive
text: helper function check whether reactive variables added Repro object already exists. Used avoid duplicate definitions added script.

title: Reactive Variables Definition Check — is_new_reactive
text: new, exisitng named list reactive variable defintions

title: Reactive Variables Definition Check — is_new_reactive
text: boolean stating whether least one reactive definition new exist existing

title: Reproduce Code — repro
text: Construct code within given reactive object able re-create output outside Shiny session.

title: Reproduce Code — repro
text: x reactive object make reproducible

title: Reproduce Code — repro
text: character string, printed (using cat), displays script reproduces contents x.

title: Reproduce Code — repro
code: library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   h1("Reproducible Code Example"),   inputPanel(     sliderInput(       "min_width",       "Minimum Petal Width",       min(iris$Petal.Width),       max(iris$Petal.Width),       min(iris$Petal.Width),       step = 0.1     ),     selectInput(       "summary_fn",       "Summary Function",       c("Mean" = "mean", "Median" = "median", "SD" = "sd"),       selected = "mean"     )   ),   fluidRow(     column(       width = 5,       h2("Table"),       tableOutput("table")     ),     column(       width = 7,       h2("Code"),       verbatimTextOutput("code")     )   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   iris_filt <- reactive({     iris[with(iris, Petal.Width > input$min_width), ]   })    summary_tbl <- reactive({     aggregate(       Sepal.Width ~ Species,       data = iris_filt(),       FUN = get(input$summary_fn)     )   })    output$table <- renderTable(summary_tbl())   output$code <- renderText(repro(summary_tbl)) }  if (interactive()) {   shinyApp(ui, server) }

title: Reproduce Code Chunk — repro_chunk

code: Repro(code = list(), packages = character(0), prerequisites = list())

title: Reproducible Code — Repro
text: code Code chunks found given expression packages Packages found function calls code /pre-requisites prerequisites Code chunks used generate reactive objects found code

title: Custom S7 Classes — class_reactive
text: Additional classes include S7 use repro_code repro_code_chunk methods:

title: Custom S7 Classes — class_reactive
text: variables need handled specific way extract non-static values stored reactive calls. class_reactive class capturing reactive calls class_event_cache class capturing bindCache calls class_event_reactive class capturing bindEvent calls class_bind_reactive union class_event_cache class_event_reactive

title: Custom S7 Classes — class_reactive
text: determining evaluating chunk, function name gets attached class chunk, special cases need handled non-standard way. class_call_function class capturing anonymous function definitions class_call_reactive class capturing evaluated reactive objects class_call_reactval class capturing evaluated reactiveValues objects class_call_if class capturing calls class_call_null class capturing undefined calls, pkg::fn class_call_shiny class capturing ignorable shiny function calls req validate class_call_subset class capturing subset ($) call
